resultsSection.title: Real results
resultsSection.subtitle: Examples of how culture work translates into meaningful change.

caseStudies.challenge: Founders struggled to articulate their culture as the team grew from 5 to 25 people.
caseStudies.solution: Facilitated values workshops, created a culture playbook, and designed onboarding rituals.
caseStudies.result: 90% of new hires reported feeling "deeply aligned" with company values within 30 days.
caseStudies.details: Working closely with the founding team over 4 weeks, we ran discovery interviews with all employees, facilitated a collaborative values workshop, and translated insights into a practical culture playbook. The playbook included daily rituals, meeting norms, and a structured onboarding programme that new hires now consistently praise.

caseStudies.challenge: Leadership team communication felt inconsistent and was creating confusion across departments.
caseStudies.solution: Developed a leadership narrative framework and trained senior leaders on consistent messaging.
caseStudies.result: Employee understanding of company direction improved by 45% in quarterly surveys.
caseStudies.details: The engagement began with a communication audit, identifying gaps between leadership intent and employee perception. We then co-created a narrative framework with the leadership team, including key messages, communication rhythms, and feedback loops. Monthly coaching sessions ensured the framework became embedded in how leaders showed up.

caseStudies.challenge: Rapid growth had diluted the original culture; brand and internal experience felt misaligned.
caseStudies.solution: Ran brand-culture alignment workshops and redesigned the employee experience journey.
caseStudies.result: Glassdoor rating improved from 3.2 to 4.1 within 6 months.
caseStudies.details: This comprehensive engagement involved cross-functional workshops bringing together marketing, HR, and operations leaders. We mapped the employee journey against brand promises, identified friction points, and co-designed improvements. The result was a unified experience where external brand and internal culture reinforced each other at every touchpoint.

faqSection.title: Common questions
faqSection.subtitle: Answers to things clients often ask before we start working together.

items.question: What are typical engagement timelines?
items.answer: Most engagements range from 2-6 weeks, depending on scope. Starter Sessions are single events, Sprints typically run for 2 weeks, and Partner engagements usually span 4-6 weeks. We'll agree on timelines before we start based on your specific needs.

items.question: How do engagements work with a solo consultant?
items.answer: You get direct access to senior expertise without the overhead of a large consultancy. I handle all discovery, design, and delivery personally—meaning consistent quality and no junior handoffs. For larger projects, I occasionally bring in trusted specialists, always with your agreement.

items.question: Do you work remotely or on-site in the UK?
items.answer: Both. I'm based in the UK and happy to work on-site for workshops and key meetings. Discovery interviews and ongoing support often work well remotely. We'll design the right mix for your context and preferences.

items.question: What industries do you specialise in?
items.answer: I've worked across tech, healthcare, professional services, and creative industries. Culture challenges share common patterns regardless of sector—what matters most is your willingness to engage honestly with the process.

items.question: What do you need from us to start?
items.answer: A discovery call to understand your context and goals, access to key stakeholders for interviews, and a primary point of contact. I'll provide a clear brief of what's needed once we agree on scope.

items.question: How do you measure culture impact?
items.answer: Measurement is tailored to your goals. This might include pulse surveys, engagement metrics, qualitative feedback, or business outcomes like retention and productivity. I'll help you define meaningful measures that make sense for your context.

items.question: Is there a minimum contract?
items.answer: No minimum contract. Starter Sessions are standalone. Larger engagements are scoped and priced individually based on your needs. If we're not the right fit, I'll tell you—there's no benefit in forcing an engagement.

items.question: Can you support comms and brand alignment too?
items.answer: Yes. Culture and brand are deeply connected. I help organisations ensure their internal culture and external brand tell the same story. This often involves working alongside your marketing or comms teams.
